item.title: [PARKHOSPS] Park Medi World Ltd Acquires Krishna Super-speciality Hospital for INR 40 Cr.
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Park Medi World Limited has approved the acquisition of Krishna Super-speciality Hospital, a 250-bedded facility with 70 ICU beds, modular operation theatres, and automated laboratories. The hospital is owned by Mahip Hospitals Private Limited and is strategically positioned in Bathinda, serving as a vital healthcare hub. Park Medi World Limited has been managing operations since July 2025 and has now acquired 100% shareholding. This acquisition will increase Park Group's hospital capacity and strengthen its infrastructure, supporting its plan to reach a total of 5,260 beds by March 2028.

  • Park Medi World Ltd acquires Krishna Super-speciality Hospital for INR 40 Cr.
  • Krishna Super-speciality Hospital is a 250-bedded facility with 70 ICU beds and advanced diagnostics.
  • The hospital is strategically positioned in Bathinda and serves as a vital healthcare hub.
  • Park Medi World Ltd has been managing operations since July 2025 and has now acquired 100% shareholding.
  • This acquisition will increase Park Group's hospital capacity and strengthen its infrastructure.

item.title: [ALPHAIND] Alphalogic Industries Ltd: Promoters Acquire Shares & Convertible Warrants via Preferential Allotment
item.description:
Alphalogic Industries Ltd has announced that promoters have acquired shares and convertible warrants through preferential allotment. The total number of equity shares acquired by Alphalogic Techsys Limited, a promoter, is 52,14,528, and 3,000 by Alphalogic, another promoter. The total number of convertible warrants acquired by Alphalogic Techsys Limited is 81,90,000, and 3,00,000 by Alphalogic. The warrants have a conversion price of Rs. 28/- per warrant, and the allotment date is 01.01.2026. The company secretary and compliance officer, Aayushi Khandelwal, has made the disclosure.

item.title: [METROPOLIS] Metropolis Healthcare Ltd Reports 26% Y-o-Y Revenue Growth in Q3FY26
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Metropolis Healthcare Ltd has reported a 26% year-on-year consolidated revenue growth in Q3FY26, driven by sustained momentum in preventive and wellness health check-ups under TruHealth and a strong increase in specialty testing volumes across both B2C and B2B channels. The integration of all acquisitions is progressing well, with synergies delivering operational efficiencies and strengthening operating leverage. The TruHealth Wellness and Specialty segments recorded Y-o-Y growth of ~35% and ~33%, respectively. The standalone revenues grew by approx. 15% Y-o-Y, largely on account of increased patient and test volumes and a favorable shift in product mix and realizations.
